title: Why is the song 'Hurdy Gurdy Man' used in the opening title of the TV show 'Britannia'? It seems so out of place. - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s perfect for the show on so many levels. Creepy,cool and Celtic. And aren’t the Druids like hippies? The song is not as hippy-dippy happy as it seems in the first lyrics. Rather, the theme of the song fits with the Roman conquest and accompanying brutality. Note the second lyric: “Histories of ages past unenlightened shadows cast/Down through all eternity the crying of humanity.” Humans keep repeating warlike behaviors throughout history. We never really evolve.

I thought that at first, but then its hardly a documentary is it? It’s camp, modern style seems to fit quite well with Donovan’s old hippy time song which he apparently bought off the writers for the cost of a flight to London. Britannia is NOT Game of Thrones, once you accept that it’s quiet good fun. Daft but fun. Could have done with Neil Marshall directing though. Julian Rhind-Tutt actually looks and sounds like Kings Road 1968 so Donovan sounds pretty apt.
